dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER TITLES as we move across a black rocky landscape. Canyons and crevices, pitted and gnarled — alien. Panning up off the rocks — not an alien world, but the jagged volcanic rocks of Auckland’s North Shore - to reveal RANGITOTO ISLAND on the other side of the water. Dark and sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prow of a small boat bumps against jagged black rocks. Tight shots as two young men help one another out of the boat onto the rocks, hand clasping hand. Struggling to balance on jagged volcanic rock, they steady each other, at last finding their footing: JOHAN and LENART — IDENTICAL TWINS with COPPER HAIR, dressed in coarse 19th century clothing. Ahead of them, a man stands with his back to us, looking up at the dark cone of Rangitoto. He turns to them — this is MR JONES, grey, weathered, ageless.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: When we get to the crater, use your twin- ness. Throw the stones as one.

dialogues.speaker: JOHAN
dialogues.text: I think we can.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You have to believe it. Mr Jones looks to Lenart, less certain than his brother.

dialogues.speaker: LENART
dialogues.text: But what if they come?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They’re dormant. We’1ll take them by surprise. The three of them head for the tree line.  UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 2. EXT. RANGITOTO BUSH — DAY Figures push through the thick island scrub — Johan and Lenart lead, followed by Mr Jones. Lenart strides ahead, pushing through the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Stay together! Noises rattle through the trees around them. The twins spin, pulling two round STONES from their pockets and brandishing them like weapons. A warm, fiery glow spills from between their fingers. Shapes dart in the trees, all around them. A chorus of horrible, otherworldly BARKS rings out. A DARK SHAPE seems to lash out of the shadows — Johan falls — his stone skitters across the ground —

dialogues.speaker: LENART
dialogues.text: Johan! Johan looks up at his brother, stricken — He reaches for his fallen stone — But is YANKED suddenly into the shadows with a SHRIEK! Lenart looks to Mr Jones desperately — LENART (CONT’D) Help us, Mr Jones! Mr Jones stumbles back, deciding what he must do — He looks down to see Johan’s stone lying at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The perfect volcanic cone, black against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: LENART, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please!

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dense bush rolls over rugged hills. Black clouds boil in the sky. A straight road leads out of a small COUNTRY VILLAGE through fenced paddocks. A SCHOOLBAG tumbles over a fence. A teenage girl wearing a schoolbag, RACHEL, climbs the fence and looks back. She grins, holds out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Need help? A teen boy, THEO, appears and clambers up the fence.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No. As he gets to the top, his foot slips on the wire. Instinctively, he throws out a hand, Rachel meets it with her own, steadying him on the fence. The pair are about 14 and have the same COPPER HAIR and green eyes: they’re unmistakably TWINS. They both jump down. Rachel grabs Theo’s bag and runs off, Theo in pursuit. They run together up the road — matched for speed, Rachel just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a wide gate they cross the road. Rachel swings the bag around, flinging it under a hedge. She starts down the long driveway as Theo runs for his bag.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (laughs) You are so gonna die for that! She rounds a curve in the drive and stops in her tracks —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR is parked in the driveway of the weather- beaten house ahead. Rachel stares, her eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo! Why is there a —  10 11 12 13 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo can also hear her. His own INNER VOICE joins hers, their words overlapping:

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — a police car. Rachel, where’s mum’s car —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo’s voice rings in Rachel’s head. Their thoughts have become one, a fluid sharing of words and feelings:

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — what if there's been —

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — there’s been an accident —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, alone on the road, shares her sudden alarm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — an accident. I'm sure there's —

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — there’s nothing to be scared of —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs to the house.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: — I’m scared, Theo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo drops his bag and runs up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel pulls open the screen door of the farmhouse and creeps down the long dark tunnel of the hall. Ahead, through the door, we find a POLICEMAN standing with his hat in his hands. Rachel pushes the door open further to reveal the twins’ FATHER, sitting at the table, face slack with shock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 15 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Policeman looks up, his compassionate expression chilling. Bursting into the KITCHEN, Rachel runs to her father. She searches his face for an answer to the question she’s afraid to ask. He nods, tears streaming down his face. Rachel trembles with shock —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo stops in his tracks, trembling as Rachel is — FEELING WHAT SHE'S FEELING. Theo approaches the house with trepidation. He climbs the porch, pulls open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo heads down the hallway, fearful ... IN THE KITCHEN, Rachel looks up — face wracked with grief. In the hall, Theo reels back against the wall, feeling her pain, frozen — IN THE KITCHEN, Rachel looks towards the door that separates them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo? IN THE HALLWAY, Theo shakes his head, unable to bear it. We hear her voice in his mind again, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo? I need you. Something seems to snap. Theo scrambles back up the hall, slams through the screen door and stumbles out onto the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo, I — The screen door BANGS behind him — her voice cutting off in his mind, as though a door between them has SLAMMED SHUT. We push in towards the screen door, watching him ... then PULL FOCUS to the mesh, shutting out everything beyond.  16 17 18 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 6. EXT. COUNTRY CHURCHYARD — DAY 16 A dark hole in the ground: a GRAVE. Gathered around it are two dozen MOURNERS in dark clothing and an Anglican Reverend, REVEREND BLATTY.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND BLATTY
dialogues.text: I am the resurrection and the life, saith the Lord; he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live; and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Standing on either side of the grave is Theo and Rachel, the hole in the ground a dark chasm between them. Theo looks to the head of the grave where their father kneels over the edge of the hole, sobbing. Rachel steps forward, scattering a handful of rose petals into the grave. Theo clutches a handful of petals, his expression impassive. Rachel searches Theo’s face, looking for some way in. Tears roll down her cheeks. He meets her eyes for a moment, then looks away. His petals are clenched in his fist, knuckles white. We CUT WIDE: a cluster of dark figures small in the landscape. The dark sky boils overhead. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE IN on the sprawling city of Auckland passing by, as seen from train level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train clatters and rattles. Theo peers out at the passing suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDED VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Next stop, Central Auckland. Central Auckland, next stop.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let me see — Theo shrugs her away and returns to the window. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19 20 21 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 7.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Get off! Theo looks outside again, frowns — Outside, pushing up out of the houses and roads is a GREEN VOLCANIC CONE. Up ahead, another cone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A train pulls into the station. Rachel and Theo walk past, Rachel struggling with her bag, Theo pushing on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volcanic steam clouds the air — a fountain outside the station. Through the haze, we see Theo step out of the station, looking around. Rachel appears behind him, dragging her bag.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where is he? INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/AUCKLAND PARK - DAY 21 The interior of a cramped, ratty-looking DATSUN. Two teenagers are making out clumsily. Things are almost heating up ... Knees bang against the handbrake — an elbow smacks the door —

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry. A CELL PHONE RINGS. RICKY bolts upright, bangs his head, grimaces. Ricky is 18, almost cool, but not quite old enough to pull it off. CLEMENTINE, the same age, is the kind of girl guys like Ricky get only in their dreams. We see now that the car is parked under trees — a secluded park. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 22 23 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 8.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ricky fumbles for the phone ... it falls under the seat +. he rattles around, hunting for it, crushing Clementine.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Ow — leave it — Ricky! Ricky retrieves the phone, checks it.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Oh man! What’s the time? Clementine sighs and switches off the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Datsun pulls up at the dropping zone, Ricky alone at the wheel. The twins sit on their luggage at the kerb. Ricky leans across the passenger seat and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Sorry I'ma bit late. Theo eyes the crappy car dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We’re not gonna get far in this thing.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Catch the bus if you want, I don’t care. The twins pile into the car.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Nice hickey. Alarmed, Ricky checks the rear-view mirror to find a small hickey on his neck. EXT/INT. CENTRAL AUCKLAND STREETS/RICKY’S CAR - DAY 23 The car rattles and roars in complaint as Ricky hammers down inner city streets. Rachel sits in the front; in the back, Theo looks out the window at the city. Rachel looks back, notes the BLACK CLOUD coughing out of the car’s exhaust. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 24 25 26 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 9.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I bet you can see your carbon footprint from space.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: That’s good, right? Rachel rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So your Dad ... he’s okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He just needed some ‘time out’.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He’s having a total meltdown.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That’s great. That’s a really great thing to tell people.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It’s true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We crane up as Ricky’s car crosses the harbour bridge. The spectacular collision of cosmopolitan city and Auckland's volcanic field is revealed: green cones rise beyond city buildings. Looming over everything, the dark triangle of Rangitoto Island stands guardian to the harbour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing Rangitoto is the clutter of Takapuna’s apartment buildings and malls. Beside it we find LAKE PUPUKE, a large body of water in the middle of a verdant suburb. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 26 Ricky’s car pulls up at a modernist mansion that steps down toward the lake. Rachel and Theo gape at the conspicuous opulence of the house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 27 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AUNT KAY and UNCLE CLIFF bustle out of the house as the kids climb out of the car. Aunt Kay buries them in hugs.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Hello, you two!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hi Auntie Kay. As Ricky retrieves the bags from the car, Uncle Cliff shakes hands with Theo.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (playfully serious) Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Cool place.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (heading inside) Yeah — if you wanna live in a concrete bunker.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Nobody’s forcing you!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Whatever. Ricky makes a face behind Cliff's back. The twins laugh. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - DAY 27 Kay leads Rachel into a spacious guest room with bunk beds. The curtains are drawn.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (dubious ) Bunks. Kay pauses ... looks at Rachel, misty-eyed. Rachel looks away, awkward.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: You look so much like her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 11.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel senses what’s needed: she offers a hug. Her Aunt holds her tightly, her eyes closed, comforted. Rachel's eyes remain open, her expression distant.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: I'll let you get unpacked. Kay bustles out. Rachel pulls back the curtains to reveal — A spectacular view of the lake. Houses, walkways and parks encircle its shore. Under gathering clouds, the water seems black. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S DECK - DAY 28 Theo looks out at the lake at the end of the garden. Houses ring the shimmering water. It’s darkly beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You see the volcanoes on the way in? Theo turns to see Cliff standing behind him. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Are they dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Only when they erupt. But there hasn’t been an eruption round here for a few hundred years.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I wanna go check them out.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You don’t have to go far — (points to the lake) You're right on the edge of one.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The lake?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: It’s a crater. Theo looks back to the lake, eyes widening.  29 30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 12. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S BACK GARDEN - DAY 29 Theo walks down the lawn to the lake’s edge. He stops and sniffs, recoiling at a smell. He looks out across the lake, scanning the houses around the shore. His eyes fall on one. He steps forward to see better. Across an inlet is a two-story wooden house, its weatherboards flaky and peeling. More than 100 years old, the craggy verandahs and dark windows make the house feel like a dark sentinel watching the lake.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s that smell? Rachel is behind him. Theo doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Like rotten cabbages. Is it the water? Theo looks back across the lake to the house ...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I can’t smell anything. He turns and walks up the lawn. Rachel watches him go, frustrated. She steps out to the edge of the water and looks out at the old house. Spooky place. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DUSK 30 An open package of fish and chips hits the floor. Uncle Cliff grabs a handful of chips and collapses onto the couch in between Theo and Ricky, who protest noisily.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (cuffles Theo's hair) Just getting closer to the fire. Theo rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: And there are kayaks — Richard, you'll show them the kayaks? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ricky is sending a text message, frantically thumbing the numbers on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: They’re under the house, round the back.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Show them.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: When do we get to meet this girl? What’s her name — Tangerine?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (glares) Clementine. Theo looks around for something ... turns to see Rachel holding out the sauce bottle with a half-smile. He snatches it and pours sauce onto his plate.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What’s up with that old house?

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: The Wilberforce place?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: They're freaks, eh.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: They just keep to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I've seen him sitting out there by the lake at, like, two o’clock in the morning and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Old people have trouble sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You’d know.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You might be old one day, if you're really lucky.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: It used to be a funeral home.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Richard ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 14.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (laughing) Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: For real! Crazy old guy still drives the hearse.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: Honestly ...

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: His car does look like a hearse ...

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I bet the house is full of corpses. He probably does autopsies and taxidermy and stuff ... Rachel goes pale at talk of funeral parlours and bodies.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Shut up, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He might embalm you if he catches you —

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Shut up! A LOW RUMBLE. The house SHAKES around them — an EARTHQUAKE! Theo looks around, wide-eyed, as the furniture and knick-knacks shift and rattle. Quickly, the tremor subsides. They exchange glances, scared — thrilled — then everyone talks as once:

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: God, another one ...

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Don’t everybody get under the table at once.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: That’s gotta be a 3.5, a four even!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That was awesome! Kay looks at Cliff, worried.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: It‘'ll be fine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 31 32 33 34 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amid the chatter and bustle, Rachel is quietly terrified. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 31 Rachel emerges from the bathroom in her pyjamas, heads down the hall. MURMURS come from inside Ricky’s room. Rachel pauses in the doorway, eavesdropping. THROUGH THE GAP we can see Ricky lying on his bed, talking quietly on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I can’t. (beat) I’m supposed to drive my cousins around. (beat) I know ... I do want to, I promise. Rachel steps away from the door and heads towards the guest bedroom. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 32 Theo lies awake in the top bunk. Rachel enters in her pyjamas, closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (whispers) Theo? Theo pretends to be asleep. Rachel pads to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sinister shape of the Wilberforce house across the lake. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 34 Rachel peers through the murk at the eerie house. From his bed, Theo watches Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: 34B
dialogues.text: 35 36 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tall figure of a MAN stands in the shadows under the rusting verandah. He seems to be looking back at Rachel. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 34B Rachel stares back, a little spooked. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE/KITCHEN - MORNING 35 A note on the bench reads GONE TO WORK - EAT REAL FOOD! A large kitchen with expensive fittings. A small TV, switched on, the sound muted. On the bench is a selection of cereal boxes. Theo scans them, trying to decide. MOMENTS LATER: Theo serves himself a bowl of ice cream and starts eating. On TV, a smiling TV NEWS READER talks against a backdrop image of CENTRAL AUCKLAND and the heading Auckland Shaken. Theo grabs the REMOTE and switches on the sound —

dialogues.speaker: NEWS READER
dialogues.text: Aucklanders ducked for cover last night as the latest in a series of small earthquakes rattled the region. The shallow jolt measured 3.7 on the Richter Scale and was centred on Rangitoto Island. The Seismic Research Institute said today that the quake is unlikely to be an indication of volcanic activity, and Aucklanders have no cause for alarm. (beat) The meat industry is breathing a sigh of relief today after lamb exports were given the all clear following an unexplained incident at a lower North Island sheep station ...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 36 An ARTIST'S RENDERING of RANGITOTO in full eruption, dark clouds a FIERY RED. The heading reads RANGITOTO - “BLEEDING SKIES”. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 37 38 39 40 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 17.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to himself) Bleeding skies. Theo sits in a soft couch with his back to the lake. He’s reading a hardback book — VOLCANOES OF AUCKLAND, circa the 1980s. He flips through the pages. A MAP OF AUCKLAND shows the VOLCANOES marked in red. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 37 Rachel, in a bright life jacket, drags a kayak down the grass to the water’s edge. She climbs in and pushes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel cuts across the black water, paddling carefully but confidently. She peers down into the darkness, spooked — it’s deep down there. Rachel looks up to find she’s nearing the Wilberforce house. Dead trees frame the house, skeletal fingers reaching out across the water. Seen from the lake through leafless branches and tangled vines, the Wilberforce house is dark and tumbledown, weatherboards thick with moss, roof rotten and sunken-in, windows dark. No signs of life. CREEAAK! The back door opens, just a crack. Something moves in the darkness beyond. Rachel's eyes widen ... then she squeals as a branch snags her hair. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 39 Theo jerks, reaches to his head. He looks out to where Rachel and the kayak bob in the shadow of the dead trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel reaches up to find that her hair tie is gone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 41 42 43 44 45 46 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 18.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a last glance at the old house, she turns and paddles for shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel drags the kayak out of the water into the reeds at the lake's edge. She looks back at the Wilberforce house. A figure picks its way down from his house towards the lakeshore. Rachel ducks behind the reeds, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the shadow of the house, the man moves as if slowed and bent by age, but his frame is monumental. His lined face seems roughly hewn from stone, eyes black holes under heavy brows. MR WILBERFORCE reaches into the dead tree. He takes something from its branches, opens his hand to reveal — Rachel's hair tie. Mr Wilberforce slowly raises his hand to his face ... and seems to SNIFF at the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel watches, horrified ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Wilberforce closes a club-like fist around her hair tie and crunches back up the path to his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel shrinks, chilled. She looks around the lawn, suddenly feeling vulnerable. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY 46 In the living room, Theo turns to the next page. More images — another volcano — a grassy cone with a view out over the city ...  47 48 49 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 19. EXT/INT. MT EDEN ROAD/RICKY’S CAR - DAY 47 Ricky’s car drives through the centre of Mt Eden, towards the grassy cone of the volcano towering above. A sign reads MT EDEN SUMMIT. Ricky’s car follows the road up towards Mt Eden. Ricky drives, the twins crammed into the car with him. Craggy trees line the road like a tunnel of gnarled talons, sunlight filtering through in eerie shafts. Rachel’s eyes widen — A DARK FIGURE can be glimpsed between the trunks, still as a statue, as if watching the car. Rachel looks back — the figure is gone, hidden by the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge grassed bowl — the crater of this not-long-dead volcano. Rachel, Theo and Ricky stand on the platform, dwarfed by the scale of it. Beyond, over city and water, is Rangitoto.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (pointing) That’s One Tree Hill ... Mt Krakatoa over there ... Mt Vesuvius ... Mt Etna. That’s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North Head and Rangitoto. Rachel shivers against the cold.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I thought Auckland was supposed to be warm.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’m gonna find some volcanic rock. Theo jumps down off the stone wall and heads around the crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo marches around the edge, putting all his being into walking hard, making himself feel nothing else. A cold wind whips at him, the sky is grey. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 50 51 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 20.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stops and looks down into the deep hole, the people at the bottom tiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks out across the city. Ricky leans on the fence, texting. Beyond, Theo strides around the crater rim. Ricky looks up from his phone, watches Theo.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can’t get through to him. It’s like he’s on another planet. EXT. MT EDEN CRATER RIM — DAY 51 Theo looks up to the crest of the hill above him. A figure sits, silhouetted on the edge, facing Rangitoto. Mr Jones is barely older than when we last saw him, but he seems a shadow of his former self: beaten, the fire has died in his eyes. He stares across at the black island opposite. A warm glow of FIRELIGHT dances on his face, emanating from his hands. Theo approaches the old man from behind. A flicker of FLAME in his hands. Theo peers closer, intrigued. As Theo steps up Jones closes his hands, the fire disappears. He stuffs whatever made the fire into the pockets of his jacket. He turns to Theo, his eyes blazing with momentary interest. He looks up at Theo’s copper hair. Theo raises a hand to his hair involuntarily. The man seems to stare into him, read him, as if looking for an answer from him ... Theo turns and hurries on around the crater. As he goes the light in the old man’s eyes dies — as if he was searching for something and realised, with disappointment, it wasn’t to be found with Theo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 52 53 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 21.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He looks back across the city and sea to the distant volcano. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S KITCHEN - EVENING 52 Ricky is getting a grilling from Kay and Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Cause I’ve got things to do.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Better things.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Okay, but you’re taking the twins with you.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I don’t get why I have to babysit them. They're not kids —

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: We're not saying they are.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Why’d you put them in bunks then? INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - EVENING 53 Theo reads, the volcano book open on his lap. Rachel talks on the phone, trying to shield the mouthpiece from the argument in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Nothing got broken but the whole house was shaking ...

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have to start taking some responsibility, Richard ...

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A “commitment” is where you actually have to do whatever it is you said you'd do. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 55 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 22.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Anyway, we'll tell you about it when we get home. Sorry you’re not there ...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you, my English teacher?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (into the phone) -.-. hope you’re okay. I love you. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S KITCHEN - EVENING 54 Cliff leans in towards Ricky, so as not to be overheard.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: You think this is hard on you? Try and imagine what Rachel and Theo are going through. Ricky looks away, guilty.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You promised to do your part.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Like I need reminding. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - EVENING 55 Ricky stomps past as Rachel holds the phone out to Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (without looking up) I‘m reading.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s just voicemail. She’s still holding out the phone. He sighs, takes it, then waits ... At last, she gets his drift and leaves the room. As soon as she’s gone, Theo switches off the phone and puts it aside. He picks up the book. In a sepia-toned photograph, a group of settlers picnics on the shore of Lake Pupuke. A man stands apart, looking towards the camera: MR JONES. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 56 57 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo frowns. There’s something familiar about the old man in the photo ... EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 56 The house glows pale, like boxes of reflected moonlight on the dark shore. Rachel looks out the window in the direction of the Wilberforce house — then pulls the curtains across. In the darkness, a sickly SNIFFING sound, like some guttural animal following a scent. SHAPES melt out of the darkness — one, three, five, more: dark sentinels push forward from the shadows. In the darkness, we can make out several MEN IN DARK SUITS. They stare up at the house, watching, waiting ... EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 57 Ricky comes out of the house, followed by Theo and Rachel. They join Uncle Cliff who glares down at the lawn, his expression dark.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) You lot know anything about this? Dead patches of grass blot the lawn. Trails of brown lead back to the edge of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Well, I haven’t been out here.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Why is everything my fault? It’s outside their room, anyway. The trail of footprints does indeed lead towards Rachel and Theo’s window. Rachel and Theo follow the trail to below their window.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (quietly to Theo) Someone's spying on us! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 58 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo’s eyes alight with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah! She meets his gaze, spooked ... then turns to look back across at the Wilberforce house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rangitoto — as seen from the surface of the sea: a black pyramid, filling the horizon. Uncle Cliff stands on the deck of a bobbing boat — THE SEA LADY — expertly playing and casting a large fishing rod. Ricky sits behind, wearing a lifejacket and holding his phone in the air, trying to get a signal. A snorkel surfaces from the black water in a puff of spray ... Theo follows it, coming up for air. He turns towards the mountain, treading water. Theo jerks under — — then comes up spluttering. Rachel surfaces behind him and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Dick. Theo swims back towards the boat. Rachel looks up at the looming black peak and frowns, as though remembering something once said to her ...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Bleeding skies. She GASPS suddenly, catching a glimpse of — A FIGURE, lurking in the trees above the rocks at the water’s edge. A Wilberforce DRONE. Chilled, Rachel swims strongly to the boat and hauls herself on board. She looks back towards the island — there’s no sign of the Drone now — Suddenly, Cliff’s fishing rod SCREAMS as the reel unwinds. He grabs the handle, reels furiously. The rod bends alarmingly. He shouts — — and heaves a flapping fish over the side of the boat. The others jump back as he lowers it to the deck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 60 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 25.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Well, don't just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glassy-eyed fish hits a sheet of newspaper laid out on the asphalt. A concrete boat ramp leads down to a sandy North Shore beach. Ricky and Uncle Cliff hook the boat trailer onto the car. Theo wrinkles his nose and looks around ... frowns as something further around the road catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo holds his hand over his nose and mouth as he approaches the Wilberforces’ hearse, parked under trees. Rachel scampers to catch up with him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s a hearse. Must be them — the Wilberforces. She stops, her hand going to her nose. Theo gags.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It stinks!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The same as at the lake. The twins reach the hearse. The back doors are closed. Something viscous drips from them onto the ground. Theo cups his hand against the back window to peer in. His breath fogs the glass. Something coats the inside, obscuring the view. He reaches for the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't ... Theo pulls the doors open. It opens with a SCHLUK, like a wound being pulled open. Stringy slime clings to the edges. The twins grimace in disgust as they see — The hearse interior is warped and gnarled, crusted with glistening layers of organic matter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 61 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 26.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel gags, her hand going to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? Theo reaches out to touch the fleshy interior, then jerks his hand back.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What, is it hot?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's cold!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I wonder what they’re doing here. Rachel turns, looks out to sea: Rangitoto lurks on the horizon beyond the dark water. RACHEL (CONT’D) Theo, are they watching us? Theo stares into the depths of the car, eyes bright with interest. INT. RICKY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 61 Theo bursts into Ricky’s dark bedroom, binoculars and a torch in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Theo! Theo goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Keep the light off, that’s good. He peers through the binoculars. There is a thump and rustle from behind him. Theo lowers the binoculars and turns around. Ricky glowers at Theo as Clementine, sitting on the edge of the bed, pulls her T-shirt on over her bra. Theo stares, open mouthed. Clementine glares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Enjoying the view? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 27.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Clem, wait ... She pushes past Theo and goes to the window. She pushes it open and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Call me when the school holidays are over. She throws a leg over the sill and jumps out the window. Theo watches her go ... and then looks back to Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Is she your girlfriend? Have you ... Ricky collapses on his bed, pulls his pillow over his head and MOANS!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: No! Theo watches him for a minute ... Ricky plays dead. Theo goes back to the window, training the binoculars on the Wilberforce house.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You think they’re home?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (muffled under covers) It's just a creepy old house.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Then let’s go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why not? Ricky wrenches his pillow from his face.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Cause it’s a creepy old house! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 64 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 28.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo turns back, intent. Through the binoculars: the Wilberforces’ door is a dark maw in the face of the house. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 62 Rachel lies on the bed, reading. The sound of a door opening offscreen. She gets up and goes to the window. She sees movement — OUTSIDE, Theo steps out of Ricky’s glass doors into the back garden. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 63 Ricky leans out of the doors.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Don’t blame me if Mr Wilberforce keeps a shotgun under his bed or something. He slams the door shut. Theo turns on the torch and heads around the lakeshore towards the Wilberforce house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torch beam picks out the craggy trees — pale claws of wood dance in the darkness. Theo picks his way through skeletal bushes. His torch picks out an OLD SIGN, lying tangled in dead creepers and branches. Theo clears them away to reveal the faded words beneath: WILBERFORCE FUNERAL SERVICES. He clicks off the light and watches, breathing quietly. The house is silent, the door closed. Slipping from his hiding place, Theo darts up the bare ground to the house. He tries to peer through the boards on the windows, then steps up on the porch — wooden boards creak. The front door seems to be locked. Theo pushes on it, experimentally — it opens a crack — FOOTSTEPS crunch toward him from the darkness. He plasters himself against the wall — pinned, exposed — (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 65 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 29.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Theo? Theo breathes again as Rachel climbs the steps. Theo flicks on the torch and points it into her face. Rachel shields her eyes from the sudden glare.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't go in there.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I can do what I want. He turns off the torch and heads back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel appears behind Theo and they stare, open mouthed . What may have once been rooms, furniture or stairs have decayed into an open cavernous space. Everything grows with twisted organic matter — as if the house itself has formed out of gnarled scar tissue. The twins creep forward to look, taking it in with horror. Theo swings the torch slowly around. Vague remnants of wooden beams and doorways poke from the awful fleshiness. A sudden JOLT, as though someone just picked the house up and shook it — then a CLATTER as an EARTHQUAKE rolls through the house, its ancient weatherboards shifting and groaning. Dust sifts down from above. Silence. The twins look around, wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The gargantua ...

dialogues.speaker: DRONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They shake the earth. The twins jump at the sound of the voices, coming from the door to outside. They duck into the shadow of a hallway. Theo fumbles to kill the torch.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Turn it off! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 30.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo turns off the light, just as two tall figures step into the room - MR WILBERFORCE and a WILBERFORCE DRONE.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Soon they are free. Mr Wilberforce looks suddenly towards Rachel and Theo and SNIFFS. Rachel and Theo pull back into the shadows, holding their breath.

dialogues.speaker: DRONE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Twins — on the lake. I smell them.

dialogues.speaker: DRONE
dialogues.text: Does the fire-raiser know?

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: The fire-raiser is old. No warm in its bones.

dialogues.speaker: DRONE
dialogues.text: If the twins find the fire-raiser?

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Then we make them dead. The twins exchange horrified glances. A SUCKING SOUND. Theo peers around broken boards and old joists, trying to see into the hallway. A glimpse of the Drone, disappearing into the hole in the floor with another weird SLURP. Rachel and Theo wait a moment, then step hesitantly out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (whispers) Are they gone?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah — down that hole.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I was trying to tell you — they can smell us, just like we can smell them! Theo heads across the room, torch raised. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 66 67 68 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 31.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RACHEL (CONT’D) We have to go. Come on! Theo arrives at the edge of the hole and peers down. The torch beam picks out details of another fleshy space — even more organic than that above it. A sealed membrane. BARRP! The membrane undulates, draws back — revealing a rippling tunnel. Rachel and Theo recoil — Theo drops the torch — it tumbles into the darkness. The twins freeze, eyes on the hole in the floor. Silence ... then a horrible, clattering BARK rings out from far below! The twins break for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins run down the back steps and into the dead bushes at the lake’s edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins pick their way through the bushes. Behind them, Mr Wilberforce appears on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Look! The twins duck down and watch as Mr Wilberforce scans the lakeshore. He holds THEO’S TORCH in his hand. The twins cringe as another hideous BARK rings out. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 68 The twins slip inside and lock the back door. Theo is shaking with adrenalin, Rachel wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why did you have to kick that torch?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No one asked you to come.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We're supposed to be there for each other! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 32.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Says who — Dad?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We should tell someone.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Not till we know what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But they're gonna kill us!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (shrugs) So?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don’t mean that! Rachel reaches out to grasp his hand. WHISPERS reverberate around them as their fingers almost connect.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Get off! He tries to pull away, but she grabs his hand tightly. Whispers swirl as Rachel’s voice resonates in Theo’s mind:

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my ... (head)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -+. I need to know you're not gonna ... (just leave me)

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: ++. just leave me ... (alone)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: --- alone, Theo - I feel so alone! Theo pushes her away —

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We are alone. Get used to it. He stalks away. Slumped against the wall, Rachel quakes. In the dark ... alone.  69 70 71 72 73 74 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 33. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 69 On the couch, Theo has made up a bed with blankets and a pillow. He looks at the pages of the volcano book. He turns to the page with the photo of Lake Pupuke, with its tiny image of Mr Jones —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching Mr Jones from behind to see the fire glowing in his hands — The old man searches Theo’s face — INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 71 Theo looks up from the volcano book, his eyes wide as he realises:

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The fire-raiser. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 72 Rachel crawls into the darkest corner of the bottom bunk and draws the covers up around her. She stares, wide eyed, into the darkness. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 73 Morning. The house by the lake. Its cold, hard surfaces reflect the morning light and the shimmering water. A new sign blocking the path to the back garden reads PRIVATE

dialogues.speaker: PROPERTY
dialogues.text: Grey clouds roil above. INT. RICKY’S BEDROOM - MORNING 74 Ricky sleeps — with the total commitment only an 18 year- old can afford. The door opens and Theo enters, stuffing the volcano book into his backpack as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Get up. Ricky grunts ... stirs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 75 76 77 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 34.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Wha — ?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I need a favour.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Get lost, Theo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What would your old man say if he knew what you were doing in here last night? Ricky opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t doing anything. Thanks to you. (beat) What do you want, anyway? EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 75 Ricky’s car — with Ricky and Theo inside — whines up the drive. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 76 The living room — empty. The kitchen, hall, stairs — empty. Rachel pads out of her room, zipping up a baggy hoodie.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hello? Aunty Kay? Theo? She opens the door to Ricky's room and looks in. No one there. She spots the binoculars, where Theo left them the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the crater of Mt Eden, we look across Auckland towards Rangitoto as grey clouds roll over the city. In the car park, Ricky is asleep in his car. Theo heads around the crater towards the bench where Mr Jones was sitting. He carries the volcano book.  78 79 80 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 35.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 79
dialogues.text: EXT. MT EDEN CRATER RIM — DAY 80 Theo arrives at the bench — to find it empty. He sighs, defeated — A hand grabs his shoulder, spins him around —

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: What do you want? Mr Jones looms over him. Theo trembles in fear. He opens the book, shows Mr Jones the photo.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That's you, right?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You're mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You're the fire-raiser. Mr Jones frowns, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: No — my name is Jones.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: But they call you that. The Wilberforces. Mr Jones hands Theo back the book.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: I don’t know anyone by that name. And I don’t know you. He turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Wait — they said they’d kill us — me and my sister. Jones stops in his tracks, suddenly interested — almost wolfish.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You're twins. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 36.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Surprised, Theo nods. MR JONES (CONT’D) The Wilberforces have seen you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They could smell us. Jones looks around, as if suddenly paranoid. Theo follows his gaze. A GANGLY FIGURE stands silhouetted on the far side of the crater rim, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? CLOSE ON: the figure, thin and somehow disjointed- looking, dark eyes under craggy features — a WILBERFORCE, watching Theo and Mr Jones, eyes glittering with malice —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in the shadows of the house, Mr Wilberforce raises his head, eyes wide, hearing something we cannot —

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 82
dialogues.text: 83 EXT. MT EDEN CRATER RIM — DAY 83 Mr Jones squints towards the gangly figure, recognising it for what it is.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Where’s your sister now?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Our Aunt and Uncle’s place — the lake. Mr Jones takes Theo’s shoulders, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: She’s alone ... at Lake Pupuke? Theo nods.

dialogues.speaker: 83B
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 37. INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/MT EDEN CAR PARK - DAY 83A Ricky jerks awake with a YELP as Mr Jones climbs into the car.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Hey get outta my car, old man! Theo climbs in after him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It’s okay, he’s with me.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Well, he’s not with me!

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Just do what you’re told, boy — drive.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We have to go home.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Half an hour ago all you wanted to do was get outta there.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (sighs to himself) Children ...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Hey! Who the hell are you, anyway? Mr Jones glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Now, Ricky! Theo’s expression is deadly urgent. Ricky thinks about it a moment longer — then starts the car. INT. AUNT AND UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - DAY 83B Rachel watches the Wilberforce house through the binoculars. Nothing to see — then movement catches her eye — Rachel gasps as her binoculars find Mr Wilberforce stepping out of the shadows onto the porch of his house. He looks straight at her! She ducks back from the window.  84 85 86 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 38. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 84 Rachel runs down the stairs. She locks the front door, slides the chain across. She looks around, the house suddenly terrifyingly exposed: windows everywhere. Rachel pulls curtains across frantically. She gets to the kitchen and checks that the door is locked. She ducks, panting, against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel peers out the window. There’s no sign of Mr Wilberforce. Rachel gasps with fear, realising she’s lost track of him BANG-BANG! Pounding on the front door. Rachel shrieks with fright.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (shouts) Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Police! Shaking with fear, Rachel approaches the door. She peers through the window next to it — outside, we can see a POLICEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open the door, please. Rachel reaches for the door handle —

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’ve got a message for the twins. Rachel frowns. Her hand pauses on the door handle.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There's been an accident.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (shocked) What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She reaches for the door ...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: It’s ... mother. Rachel hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Been ... hurt.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But ... Outside the Policeman trembles. His skin twitches, bubbles, glistens ...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Open the door. Rachel kicks over potted plants as she backs away from the door, shaking her head in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Open the door ... let us in!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Open ... the ... door! WHAMP. The door shakes. BAM BAM BAM. Again ... then ... Silence. Rachel stares at the door, breathless. The wood around the door handle begins to fester and decay. A spreading patch becomes the sickly dead flesh of the Wilberforces’ house. The lock sloughs away; the door slams open, BANGING on the end of the chain. The Policeman’s hand and the door are melded together, his fingers disappearing into the rotting surface of the door. Now fingers push out of the surface of the door — becoming an arm — part flesh, part wood, part uniformed sleeve — that reaches up for the chain. The fingers claw the latch of the chain and gouge it out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 87 88 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The door bursts open and the Policeman steps in. His face has lost its shape, hanging loose and wet. His uniform seems to be running into his flesh, detail blurring. At the end of his arm, his uniformed sleeve and hand are ill-formed, a fleshy club. Rachel screams and stumbles back into the stairs. She turns and scrambles up them. The Policeman strides up after her.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 87
dialogues.text: INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE/MEZZANINE - DAY 88 Rachel runs along the mezzanine, around the corner to the bedrooms. The Policeman strides forward, menacingly confident now. He pauses at the corner, steps powerfully into the bedroom — And finds empty room and closet doors. He sniffs ... And homes in on a door. He snatches it open — A GOLF BAG falls out, clubs tumbling. The Policeman twitches, peers into the closet — Rachel EXPLODES out, swinging a GOLF CLUB. She smashes at the Policeman — he recoils, barely — and snarls. His face shudders, skin blisters ... what looks like wormlike tentacles ripple beneath the surface of his flesh as the Policeman becomes MR WILBERFORCE! Rachel gasps. She throws the club at Wilberforce, he smashes it to the left, she ducks past on the right. She gets to the balcony of the mezzanine, clambers over, jumps — As Wilberforce reaches out and grabs her arm, arresting her fall, jerking her horribly. Rachel screams, in pain and terror. Wilberforce’s hand STRETCHES from his body, his wrist and dark suited sleeve a fibrous melange. Strands, like tiny tentacles, whip around Rachel’s arm, binding her to him. The fabric of Rachel’s top becomes one with Wilberforce’s flesh, growing into it like a festering wound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 89A
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 4l.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel grits her teeth in agony. Tears spill from her eyes. Fingers of putrefaction creep up her shoulder towards her neck. INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/TAKAPUNA STREETS - DAY 88A Theo flinches suddenly, his hand going to his arm. He grimaces in agony.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: She’s hurt! In the back seat, Mr Jones watches Theo — his eyes blazing with interest. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE/MEZZANINE - DAY 88B Dangling high above the floor like a fish on a line, Rachel twists around and unzips the hoodie and slips out of Mr Wilberforce's clutches, dropping — hard — onto the couch below. Rachel rights herself, stunned, and stumbles to the kitchen. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S BACK GARDEN - DAY 89 Rachel staggers away from the house towards the lake shore, her arm hanging limp, the skin blistered. She looks into the water. Her terrified reflection stares back from the surface. She looks back to see Mr Wilberforce striding down the garden toward her ... then throws herself into the water. Mr Wilberforce reaches the edge. The surface of the lake churns. There’s no sign of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up towards the surface. Mr Wilberforce is visible through the rippling water, searching for her. Rachel waits. A bubble of air escapes from her mouth —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 91 92 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 42. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S BACK GARDEN - DAY 89B The bubble bursts on the surface of the lake. Mr Wilberforce frowns, steps closer. A neighbour, MR CARPENTER looks across from the next section. His eyes meet Mr Wilberforce’s. Seeing his expression, Mr Carpenter frowns.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: (forced) Lovely ... day ... Mr Carpenter looks up to black clouds overhead, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: MR CARPENTER
dialogues.text: (mutters) Bloody foreigners. With a last look at the water, Mr Wilberforce turns and marches back towards his house.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 90
dialogues.text: INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY - CONTINUOUS 91 Theo steps through the ruined front door.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No ... Ricky and Mr Jones follow as Theo dashes into the house.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calls) Rach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lake laps at the reeds at the bottom of the garden. Rachel claws her way across the deck, weak and desperate. Her neck and arm are grey from Mr Wilberforce’s touch. Fingers of fleshy putrefaction trail down towards her hand. Theo runs to Rachel’s side as she slumps in the grass, Mr Jones behind him. Theo is wide eyed and pale with shock. He reaches out ... but is afraid to touch her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 92 93 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 43.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo ...

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, man ... Mr Jones looks over toward the Wilberforces’ house.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: We need to get her inside. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - DAY 93 Mr Jones carries Rachel to the couch. Theo kneels close.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I'll call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: No. Mr Jones kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: So what are you, a doctor now? Ricky steps towards Mr Jones, but Theo stops him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No, wait — Mr Jones examines Rachel's arm.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Theo, this is ... this is crazy. The room fills with a warm firelight. The light emanates from the palm of Mr Jones’s hand. It spreads up Rachel’s arm — where it begins to warm the grey of Mr Wilberforce’s touch. Ricky’s mouth falls open.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or maybe it’s just me. Mr Jones's brow furrows. He grips Rachel’s arm tightly. The fire whispers around her neck then flickers, weakening. The wound on Rachel’s skin pales, fades ... the flesh KNOTTING into a bloom of SCAR TISSUE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 44,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr Jones seems to wilt, pale and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (weak) How did you — ?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Rest now. Rachel slips back into the couch. Theo pulls off his hoodie, places it over her. Ricky looks around the room at the carnage, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Why are they doing this to us?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Not now — not here. They think she’s dead, but soon they’1l pick up the scent of your twin-ness again. And they’1l come for you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) Can you drive us?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: No — there’s a way we won’t be seen. Help me get her up. Theo and Mr Jones lift Rachel to her feet. She sways, her pallor ghastly. Jones puts his arm around her, supporting her. MR JONES (CONT’D) Now you, Theo ... hold on to me. And whatever you do, don’t let go. Ricky looks up, snapping out of his daze.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Hey, what the hell?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It's okay, Ricky.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Some dodgy old man — no offense — wants to have a group hug and —

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Cover for us, okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 45.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I promised I'd look after you.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You are — if we stay here we're dead.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I’m in charge and you guys aren’t going anywhere! Mr Jones closes his eyes, his brow furrowed with the depth of his concentration. A brilliant ball of fire seems to well up inside him, its glare eclipsing both he and the twins. A WHUMP like a small sonic boom as air rushes into the space where Mr Jones and the twins were standing. Ricky stares, open-mouthed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A decrepit cottage sits wedged between ostentatious McMansions that seem determined to encroach upon its modest territory. A rushing sound grows — like the soft crackle of flames. The crackle seems to build to a rushing point. Behind the neighbours a hot light flares — and the twins and Mr Jones materialise in front of the cottage. Jones collapses to his knees, coughing and hacking. Both twins are soaked with sweat. They look around, stunned to have found themselves somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: How did you do that? Mr Jones seems to have aged ten years in the few seconds since they left the house.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Inside. Mr Jones leads the twins through the gate. A neighbour, MRS WILKINSON, Peers down from the deck of the mansion above. Her face is stony.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: My granddaughter. She’s unwell. Mrs Wilkinson stares, not quite buying it.  95 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 46. INT. MR JONES’S COTTAGE - DAY 95 Rachel and Theo look around the dusty old cottage as Mr Jones hands them mismatched glasses of water.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You'll need to rehydrate yourselves. The twins exchange glances as Mr Jones sits down.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Tell us everything. Mr Jones stares into space, as if deciding where to start.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You’ve seen them; you’ve seen what they can do.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (quietly) What are they?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: The ones you call the Wilberforces were a predatory race. They were merciless, cunning, greedy. Their hunger for power was great. All they lacked was the strength to conquer ... then they found the gargantua.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: “Gargantua?”

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Creatures with the power to lay waste to entire worlds. The Wilberforces tamed them. They evolved together over countless generations. They learned to travel through space. To make whole worlds their own. And they did it again and again ...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: To your world? Jones nods.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: A few of us escaped. We gathered our strength, and followed them here. We put them to sleep under millions of tons of rock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 97 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 47.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The volcanoes.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (nods) The largest gargantua, the mother, under Rangitoto. Mr Jones steps to the window. We push out the window to look over a long, unkempt rectangle of lawn ... to Rangitoto beyond. EXT. AUCKLAND VARIOUS — DAY 96 The peaks of One Tree Hill, Mt Wellington, Mt Mangare, Mt Eden — now unearthly and sinister amongst the sprawl of Auckland.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Her six children beneath Mount Wellington, Mount Mangere, Mount Victoria, One Tree Hill, Mount Eden and Lake Pupuke. The waters of Lake Pupuke, brooding, black. The Wilberfor house, a ghostly presence beside the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Theo are riveted as Mr Jones’s story continues.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Seven gargantua, seven Wilberforces. A deep rumble as another TREMOR shakes the earth. MR JONES (CONT’D) But the Wilberforces woke and freed themselves. Soon their gargantua will follow and it will begin. The cottage rattles as the tremor passes and dies.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Then let’s ... call the army! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 48.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: The New Zealand army?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Okay ... America! They could find the Wilberforces and nuke them! Or — Mr Jones shakes his head. He holds out his hands and reveals two round, flat STONES.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: The Wilberforces can only be defeated using these.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Rocks?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: When we found out the Wilberforces were waking up, we knew we had to destroy them. Wipe them out for good. We pooled the last of our power to make the stones. And my twin and I were chosen to wield them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Your twin? Jones nods.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Every one of my people had a twin. We shared everything. But the journey here was hard ... on us both. My twin did not survive. Mr Jones's expression is one of infinite loneliness. Rachel places a comforting hand on his arm. He looks up, his eyes burning again. MR JONES (CONT’D) My only hope was to find more twins. Twins who could use the stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soaring over the vast crater of Rangitoto, dark with trees and dense vegetation.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They must be thrown together into Rangitoto’s crater. Only twin-ness can ignite their power. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 49,

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The mother will die, then her children. And without the gargantua, the Wilberforces will perish. 99 INT. MR JONES’S COTTAGE - DAY 99 Back in the cottage —

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: ‘Twin-ness’ ...

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. Rachel looks at Theo — he avoids her gaze. MR JONES (CONT’D) One for you, Theo ... (considers them) This one. He places one on the table in front of Theo, the other closer to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this one for you. She looks at it warily. Theo reaches for his. Jones stays his hand —

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have to see them first.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I can see them.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: And ..?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They’re ... a couple of rocks. Jones stares at Theo, willing him to say more. Theo doesn’t know what’s expected of him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, rocks? Stones? Pebbles? Jones sighs.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give us a clue? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 50.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: No, that’s not it at all! (beat) It’s not your fault. I’1l have to let you go.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What about everything you said?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: There’s nothing you can do.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Because we can’t ‘see’ your stupid stones? There they are, they’re exactly the same!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Almost. Jones freezes, looks at Rachel. RACHEL (CONT’D) They’re almost the same. Theo’s is lighter than mine. Like it’s glowing. THE STONE does seem lighter than hers, a faint glow emanating. RACHEL (CONT’D) (to Theo) Can you see it?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (surprised) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Pick it up. Theo picks up the stone. Faint WHISPERS swirl around them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: It’s heavy. Warm. Theo stares into his stone. The whispers grow louder, Ripples of fire shimmer across its surface.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Open your mind to the stone. Feel its power ... let it feel yours. The stone pulses, hypnotic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 100 101 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 51.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We move INTO THE STONE. There’s a faint rumble, then bare discernible echoes — a scream, a WILBERFORCE BARK ... An image emerges ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A North Shore beach, but untouched, pristine. A tiny boat is beached just above the waterline. A tree at the edge of the beach has a CRUDE CIRCLE drawn on its trunk. Johan, one of the young men we saw earlier, steps into frame, one of the stones clenched in his hand. He looks across — To his twin, Lenart, also holding his own stone. They hold out their fists, eyes narrowing in concentrated thought — The stones glow — WHOMP! A nimbus of fire encircles each fist, then arcs out from the stone, SCORCHING the tree right where the target is drawn. They beam, triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Enough of that! They turn, Mr Jones is there. He nods approvingly. MR JONES (CONT’D) It’s time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo blinks the vision away. Mr Jones regards him expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I saw other twins.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They tried to use the stones. Many years ago.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What happened to them? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 103 104 105 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A long, haunted silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They failed. (to Rachel) Try yours. Rachel reaches for the stone. It lies grey and cold in her hand ... then starts to glow, whispering. Jones's eyes alight. Rachel smiles. The glow intensifies, white-hot. The whispers rise to a cacophony of screams. Smoke rises from between her clenched fingers ... Rachel screams and drops the stone. The stone lands on the table. Its surface fades to cool grey once again. Rachel looks down at her unmarked palm in horror. She gets up and runs outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel steps into the light and stares out across the garden towards Rangitoto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Wilberforce stands in the shadows of the back porch. Six other DARK FIGURES loom like motionless slabs — the Wilberforce DRONES, en masse.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every hour that passes, the Wilberforces grow stronger ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo looks frightened now as Mr Jones continues:

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: .».- and the bond between the two of you is weak. She needs you. And you need her. You must understand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 106 107 108 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 53.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theo looks away. MR JONES (CONT’D) What are you so afraid of? What’s more frightening than them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks out towards Rangitoto, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rach ... Theo stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I left this morning. I should've been there when ... you know.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I thought I was gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I won’t ever let that happen! He reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can take care of you. I can be strong enough for both of us. Rachel pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. Theo looks away, stung, as Rachel turns back across the water to the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR is outside the cottage. Up on the balcony of the neighbour’s house, two cops — CONSTABLE GREEN and CONSTABLE WOOD — talk to Mrs Wilkinson. She points down at the cottage, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MR JONES'S COTTAGE
dialogues.text: As Constable Green appears around the side of the house. Rachel goes pale, stumbles back, gasping in terror. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 109 112 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 54.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel loses her balance, topples backward — Into Constable Wood, who seems to appear from nowhere. She grabs Rachel from behind.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTABLE WOOD
dialogues.text: It’s okay — no one wants to hurt you. Rachel screams, fights to get free. INSIDE, Theo shrinks back against the wall. Mr Jones is calm.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: It’s all right — do what they say. Theo stuffs the stones into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. TAKAPUNA/POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: The police car drives slowly through a busy shopping area, Rachel looks out, searching the faces in the street. A WOMAN with a baby, a MAN with a briefcase, a KID holding a skateboard. They all turn to watch the Police car go past with blank faces ... any of them could be a Wilberforce ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Theo sit on plastic chairs in a stark interview room. Constable Green sits opposite.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTABLE GREEN
dialogues.text: I know the house — been empty for years. Place is a dump.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They’re going to destroy the world, and we're the only ones who can stop them!

dialogues.speaker: CONSTABLE GREEN
dialogues.text: Calm down, mate. Theo digs in his pocket. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 55.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He gave us these stones — they’re weapons, they can —

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo, no!

dialogues.speaker: CONSTABLE GREEN
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Please, sit down. The door opens. Uncle Cliff follows Constable Wood into the room. He shakes his head at Rachel and Theo in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 114
dialogues.text: INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 115 Rachel and Theo sit side-by-side on the couch. Aunt Kay and Uncle Cliff pace the room. Ricky perches on the edge of a seat, his phone in his hand. Rachel’s eyes follow the adults as they move with sullen suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We leave you for one day, you destroy the house! The front door’s ruined ...

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: We're going to the bach, at Pauanui.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL/THEO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: There won’t be any trouble there for you to get into.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: But we have to stay! Uncle Cliff -

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: We realise you've both been through a lot in the last few months, but we can't watch you every second of the day. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 56.

dialogues.speaker: KAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Especially if you’re going to wander off with complete strangers.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: He wasn’t a stranger!

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Dad, I saw it — Rachel was —

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: (to Ricky) And you're coming too. Bit of time without — (snatches Ricky’s phone) — cell coverage might be good for you.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: You know what? Sometimes you have no idea! Ricky snatches back his cellphone and stomps off towards his bedroom, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KAY
dialogues.text: (to the twins) Get an early night, eh? We’ll have to be up early. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 116 Rachel pulls the curtains across the guest bedroom window. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 117 Rachel sits down on her bed, her expression fearful. Theo enters and throws his bag up onto the top bunk.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: As soon as they’re asleep I’m going to find Mr Jones.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What if Mr Wilberforce comes? Theo makes a fist around his stone. Its warm, fiery glow paints the room around him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Then I’1l1 deal to him.  UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
