dialogues.text: Another interview room, bare and functional with a table and three plastic chairs. Fluorescent lights glare. Constable Wood stifles a yawn and checks her watch. Mr Jones sits on one side of the table. On the other sits DETECTIVE GRAY (40s), a pitcher and a glass of water between them.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: So, Mr “Jones” — when did you first make contact with Rachel and Theo Matheson?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They found me.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: But you didn’t discourage them. Two impressionable teenagers, coping with a tragedy. Vulnerable ... open to suggestion ...

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They’re a means to an end. Detective Gray nods, taking notes. MR JONES (CONT’D) Just like the others. Gray's pen pauses.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: Others?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: Tell me about them.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They were frail ... cursed with self- doubt ... weak. You all are.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: All of us, who?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: All of you humans. Gray and Wood exchange glances. Wood smirks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 58.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: I see. Gray scribbles on a pad, tears off the page and passes it to Wood. We catch a glimpse of a single word: PSYCH. Wood takes it and leaves the room. Jones watches her leave, frustrated now.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Without me they’1l be dead by morning. You have to let me go! Detective Gray meets his gaze, weighing this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo lies fully clothed on the blankets of the top bunk, snoring softly. He sleeps with his stone cradled against his chest. Rachel lies awake on the bunk beneath. TAP-TAP! A soft tap at the window. Distant thunder ROLLS as Rachel gets out of bed and opens the curtains. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S BACK GARDEN - NIGHT 120 Mr Jones stands on the lawn outside, deep in shadow. He seems pallid, almost wraithlike now. Rachel opens the window quietly.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (whispers) Come with me, quickly. She turns back to where Theo continues to sleep — MR JONES (CONT’D) Not your brother! This is just for you. With a last, uncertain look back to Theo, Rachel climbs out of the window. Rachel turns, looks around — Mr Jones has gone. She frowns, shivers. There’s movement, further around the lake towards the Wilberforce house: Mr Jones, picking his way around.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (hisses) Mr Jones — wait! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 121 122 123 124 125 126 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel pads down towards the lake, the grass wet with dew. Lightning illuminates the surface of the water —a rippling sea of black. She hurries around the lake shore. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S GUEST BEDROOM - NIGHT 121 The alarm on Theo’s watch goes off. He leans over the edge of the bed — The bottom bunk is empty. Theo stuffs his stone into his pocket and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 122
dialogues.text: EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 123 Rachel makes her way around the lake. Theo hurries down to the shore and peers after her: she’s visible around the lake shore, almost at the Wilberforce house. He starts around the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones watches from the doorstep as Rachel approaches. She pauses, confused, hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: It's safe. They’ve gone to the mountains. He disappears through the door into the house. Rachel follows. The door closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo sees the door close behind Rachel. He takes out his stone. It glows with reassuring warmth. He runs harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones — the REAL Mr Jones — cocks his head, as though listening ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 60.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The faintest of whispers in the air.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: I have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: Do you now?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: I suggest you get everyone out of the building. Detective Gray laughs. MR JONES (CONT’D) I’m tired. And I don’t know how many more times I can do this — or what might happen when I do.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: I don’t think you’re going anywhere, Mr Jones. Mr Jones glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Hot in here. Isn’t it, Detective? A bead of sweat trickles down Gray’s temple. Tiny bubbles appear in the bottom of the pitcher and float to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel follows Mr Jones into the gloom, trying to keep up, glimpsing him up ahead in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr Jones, wait!

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rach! Rachel turns to see Theo standing in the doorway. From behind them, a SLITHERING SOUND — she turns back — Mr Jones is gone. In his place, MR WILBERFORCE snarls! Theo takes his glowing stone out of his pocket and holds it aloft. Whispers swirl urgently. The stone's fiery light casts flickering shadows around the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr Wilberforce circles away from the stone. Theo comes around the other way. The stone flares brighter. Mr Wilberforce steps suddenly across to block the front door, cutting off their escape. He advances on them menacingly. Rachel and Theo stumble back, through the sagging arch of a decaying doorway. They’re pushed back into a dark hallway, thick with the Wilberforces’ rot. The way behind them is blocked — But beside them is a twisted staircase. Theo pushes Rachel up, then turns back towards Mr Wilberforce. He holds up a shaking hand, glowing with fire. Wilberforce steps towards him down the passage, a tall shadow in the darkness, his movements deliberate ... relentless. Theo backs up the stairs, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Rachel scrambles to the top.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo, quickly! A dark shape leans out of the shadows behind her — thin FINGERS wrap around her MOUTH — she’s pulled back into darkness with a muffled SHRIEK! Theo wheels around on the stairs, holding up the stone, trying to see —

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Rachel! He races up the last few steps. Upstairs, the ruined house is less decayed — though patches of the Wilberforces’ fleshy rot seep up the walls into the faded wallpaper. BELOW, Mr Wilberforce lets out a clattering BARK as he climbs the stairs. Ahead of Theo, a DRONE holds the struggling Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let her go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Drone’s mouth opens in a hideous approximation of a smile. It shakes its head.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said ... LET HER GO! A burst of FLAME encircles his hand, spitting from the stone! Theo’s eyes widen in surprise. The Drone SQUEALS and drops Rachel, backing into a dark room. Theo rushes to her and helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The twins run down the hallway, to a closed door ahead. Theo turns the handle — it’s locked! Mr Wilberforce reaches the top of the stairs and advances down the hallway, his tall frame filling the passage. Though he still looks human, his skin and clothes seem to run with slime and ichor — his form breaking down. He breathes wetly and steps forward. Theo holds up his glowing stone.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Why do you resist ... because the fire- raiser tells you?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Cause we’re not gonna let you have our planet! They back away down the hall as Wilberforce advances, trailing slime. His form seems to be losing cohesion, his proportions exaggerated by the shifting shadows. The Drone stands behind him ... joined now by a SECOND DRONE, reaching the top of the stairs. In the shifting shadows, the cramped hallway seems crowded with ghastly Wilberforces. Mr Wilberforce’s arms seem distended ... his hands, the sleeves of his jacket, split into tentacles that writhe and flick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 63.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Did the Fire-raiser tell you what happen to other twins? We made them dead. Theo shakes his head, not believing this. MR WILBERFORCE (CONT’D) And the fire-raiser ... he observes them to die.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No ...

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: He does nothing. Wilberforce’s tendrils writhe against the walls, worming their way into the floor. The wood bubbles and blisters, fleshy rot spreading away from them. Theo steps in front of Rachel, shielding her.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you die ... or perhaps ... you give us your sister? The floor beneath their feet starts to fester, sagging wetly.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: You must choose. The floor cracks, dropping down as they sink into it.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (whispers to Rachel) Jump!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Jump! He jumps on the spot. The floor CRACKS, his leg punches through the rotting boards. Rachel gets it — she jumps too — The putrescent floor tears like wet bread — Wilberforce BARKS — (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 129 130 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 64.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The twins fall —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo hits the floor. He looks up to see Rachel hanging from the hole in the floor high above, legs kicking. UPSTAIRS a fleshy WILBERFORCE TENTACLE twists around Rachel’s head and shoulder. Mr Wilberforce leans over her, his human visage sloughing off to reveal a fearsome creature beneath — Rachel looks up, SCREAMS IN FRIGHT — BELOW, Theo LEAPS, grabs for her legs, yanks — Rachel tumbles down through the hole and lands BELOW. The twins scramble to their feet and race for the open front door — From above come Wilberforce BARKS — BARKS answer from the doorway — as more WILBERFORCE DRONES come onto the porch!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No ... They look around — no way out ... except the gnarled sinkhole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Down here. He grabs her and they race for the hole. As they step toward closer it opens with a wet rolling twist.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh no... The BARKS sound from above.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: There’s no other way. He grabs her hand. She nods. They leap into the tunnel — its ‘mouth’ closing around them —

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 130
dialogues.text: 131 132 133 134 135 136 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel carries them along and down — down, down ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gray steps out of the interrogation room and closes the door behind him. His shirt is soaked with sweat. He turns and bumps into Wood, who carries two cups of steaming coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE GRAY
dialogues.text: Air-con must be on the blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones closes his eyes. The pitcher of water simmers. The paint on the walls bubbles, paper on Gray’s clipboard yellows and curls. The water begins to boil. Ceiling tiles warp ... SMASH! The pitcher shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of exploding glass, Gray and Wood look back towards the interrogation room — WHOMP! An explosion rings out. The interrogation room door sucks inwards, ripping off one hinge as it splinters in half. A wave of heat ripples out into the hallway. Arms raised to shield themselves from the heat, Wood and Gray approach the interrogation room. They peer through the splintered door to see flames licking the desk and chair. Mr Jones has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo and Rachel are carried along — then dropped —

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 136
dialogues.text: 137 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into a high-ceilinged chamber. The twins get to their feet, slick with slime.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Now I know how it feels to be spew.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s find a way ... She turns to see what’s behind them, stunned — RACHEL (CONT’D) e+. Out ... A vast, shadowy cavern. It stretches into the distance, lit by an eerie glow. The huge space — a football field in length — is gnarled with putrescent Wilberforce growth. The twins have fallen from the tunnel onto a raised rib that cuts through a sea of slime to another tunnel opening in the far wall of the chamber. But dominating the space is a CREATURE. The kids’ mouths fall open as they take in a vast supertanker of flesh —a horrible wall of skin and scales, a writhing suggestion of mighty tentacles. A massive slug-like creature wallows in the mire. Its form rises and falls in time with the rumble of its breathing. Rachel and Theo stare, dwarfed by its scale. The beast unfolds a great tentacle and shifts its almost unimaginable bulk. Great waves of flesh seem to roll past as it turns. The chamber shakes, churning up great waves of scum. The twins recoil, falling to their feet. The beast opens a ghastly maw and expels a roar of septic air. The twins cover their noses and mouths.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: That’s a gargantua.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How are we supposed to fight that? Behind them the tunnel ‘swallows’ — a rush of air sucking back up into it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 137 138 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 67.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They’re coming. The twins run for a tunnel opening in the far wall and throw themselves into its gaping mouth. The muscles close around them ... and they’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky’s car is parked at the edge of the promenade. Nearby, in the shelter of a huge, gnarled pohutukawa tree, Ricky and Clementine are wrapped in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Listen ... some stuff’s been going on ... really crazy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: What stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What if I said ... uh...

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What if I said the world was gonna end? Maybe real soon. She stares. At last, she smiles ...

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: How soon?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Maybe ... tonight?

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Then I’d say ... She leans forward slowly to kiss him ...

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t want to die ... without ... Their lips almost touch ... when something catches her eye behind him. She SHRIEKS, pulls back —

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What? Clementine points with a trembling finger — (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 68.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Dirty old man! Ricky leaps up — MR JONES stands behind the arm of the tree.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: The twins need your help.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: The twins are in bed — and you’re supposed to be in jail! Mr Jones points down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They’re somewhere out there. Ricky looks from Clementine to Mr Jones and back, agonising. He steps towards Mr Jones, conspiratorial.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (low voice) Gimme ten minutes?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (low voice) If they die, we all die.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (meekly) Five? Jones stares coldly. Ricky sighs and turns back to Clementine.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Ricky, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I have to go. (grins) But then I’m gonna come back. Ricky sweeps Clementine into a theatrical kiss, as though it might be their last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins are pushed through the tunnel into a womb-like chamber. They scramble to their feet and search wildly for an exit — dead end. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 69.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No! He kicks the tunnel wall in frustration. The dead end seems to close in around the twins. The sound of the Wilberforces rushes up the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense. A tunnel’s got to go somewhere. Rachel looks up — Above is the closed fist of a tunnel entrance. She stretches to push her hand up through the fleshy valve with a vile SQUELCH. She withdraws her hand and touches a fingertip to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Salt water. Barks echo from behind them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I'll give you a leg up. Rachel steps forward. Theo helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath and kick as hard as you can. He helps her up into the pinched maw - she pushes hands through, finds leverage ... She takes a deep breath and shoves her head into the hole. Shoulders, torso, hips ... and finally shoes disappear with a sucking noise. Alone now, Theo looks back. The maw of the tunnel parts, expelling air in advance of its passengers — Theo jumps up to grasp the edges of the membrane. He can't pull himself up. He jumps again, desperate now as the rushing echo of the Wilberforces fills the air. Panicking, Theo watches the tunnel opening, eyes wide with terror — Water splatters down. Theo looks up as Rachel’s arm emerges through the membrane, her hand held out for him. Theo looks up at her hand, considering — deciding — (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 140 141 142 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He jumps up to grab her outstretched fingers. Whispers swirl — Rachel hauls him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo surfaces, gasping for air. Rachel treads water nearby. The churning swell is black. Behind them, the dark shape of Rangitoto looms beneath the low cloud. Nearby scattered lights stretch away around the North Shore coastline.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Swim! They kick for shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins reach the sand and scramble out of the lapping water. They look back to see a phalanx of gangly brutes in suits — the Wilberforces, almost back to their human form again. They stride out of the water, relentless, Mr Wilberforce in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Nowhere to run. Both kids are pale, shaking with cold and exertion. Theo steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo ... Theo looks at the stone — not sure what it can do, but sensing what it might. He closes his fist around his stone — flames lick around his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (flashback) Open your mind to the stone. Rachel seems to will Theo to succeed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The flames grow in intensity. Hot sparks flicker into the air.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (flashback) Feel its power, and let it feel yours. WHOMP! A hot ring of fire rolls out from the twins — The Wilberforces shriek. Their flimsy human skins blister, revealing slug-like horrors beneath, as they flinch away from the light. Theo gapes at his fist, stunned at the power he’s unleashed. He looks up again, eyes blazing —

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rachel! Theo! Mr Jones and Ricky are at the car, at the edge of the beach. Rachel and Theo run towards it. The Wilberforces rise slowly. Tentacles wrap back around each other, weaving sinew and muscle into human form. The twins jump into the car as Ricky pulls away. Mr Wilberforce steps up, reconstituted, steam rising off his body. The Drones join him in watching Ricky’s car disappear into the distance. Mr Wilberforce’s tone is impassive, but his eyes glitter with contained rage.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: The twin learns ... it burns us.

dialogues.speaker: DRONE
dialogues.text: Does it learn enough? Wilberforce looks out towards Rangitoto, considering this

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Find them ... make them dead. No more twin-smell. The Drone and ANOTHER go to leave. MR WILBERFORCE (CONT’D) Wait. The creatures pause. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 72.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make it hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky lets out a shaky sigh of relief. Theo grins at Mr Jones, his eyes wild.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: The fire ... they were scared.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You used the stones together?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: (proudly) Just me. Mr Jones turns away, angry. Theo looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought that’s what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You’ve shown them what you can do. Now they won’t rest till you’re dead. Theo looks away, stung. MR JONES (CONT’D) We've got no choice. I can’t protect you from them now. We have to strike, and strike fast.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: We're going to the mountain tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights wash over a sign: NORTH HEAD SUMMIT ROAD. Ricky’s car drives towards the summit of North Head, a craggy promontory at the end of a wide spit of land.Just across the harbour, Rangitoto seems frighteningly close.  145 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 73.

dialogues.speaker: EXT / INT. NORTH HEAD TUNNELS
dialogues.text: A grassy hillside gives way to crumbling concrete fortifications. The twins, Mr Jones and Ricky pick their way down stone steps into an open concrete room from which dark passages feed. Theo leads the way. Mr Jones reaches out to the wall for support, his face gaunt.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Mr Jones nods weakly. Theo looks at Rachel, worried — Rachel shrugs, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: We need to get to the island.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Can’t you just ... flame on? Mr Jones is slumped, pale and exhausted — a shadow of his former self.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) That takes fire. And mine is dying. Ricky nods, making a decision.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Meet me in an hour. Down there. He points through the hole — Below, swell breaks on a rocky shore at the foot of the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What, the boat?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Uncle Cliff'll never let you.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Like I’m gonna ask.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: If the Wilberforces find out what you're doing, they’11 kill you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 145 146 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 74.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Reckon I’m more scared of Dad. The twins rush to Ricky and hug him tight. He hugs them back.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Be careful, Ricky. The twins watch as Ricky heads away towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sloping concrete tunnels give way to narrow passages, then natural caves. Mr Jones extends a hand — a lick of flame dances in the middle of a circular grotto.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You lied to us — about the other twins! Mr Jones's eyes glimmer in the firelight.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: I told you they failed.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Yeah, pretty hard to throw a stone when you're dead! Mr Jones turns away. The twins wait for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr Jones?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: If I’d told you the truth, you wouldn’t have done what I asked. Rachel and Theo exchange horrified glances. MR JONES (CONT’D) Their names were Johan and Lenart. I'd been searching for so long, hoping to find what they had. A bond. (bitter) They gave me hope.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What happened? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 148 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 75.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: I thought it would be easy ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black altar of Rangitoto island. The night we saw in the opening scene. Familiar SCREAMS resonate — the sound of Johan and Lenart being attacked by the Wilberforces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of action — we've seen this scene before. Knocked off balance, Johan falls — his stone hits the ground —

dialogues.speaker: LENART
dialogues.text: Johan! Johan reaches for his fallen stone, only to be dragged into the shadows by the Wilberforces! This time, we glimpse the tentacled horror lurking in the trees as it snatches him away. Lenart looks to Mr Jones desperately. LENART (CONT’D) Help us, Mr Jones! Mr Jones stumbles back, deciding what he must do. LENART (CONT’D) Please! Mr Jones shakes his head sadly, almost imperceptibly. A horrible SCREAM rings through the bush, as though Johan is being torn apart. Shadows close in on Lenart and Mr Jones ... LENART (CONT’D) Please, Mr Jones! Shaking, Mr Jones turns away. As he closes his eyes tight, a single tear runs down his cheek. Fire rolls across him, and WHOMP! He’s gone. Lenart stands alone, lost and afraid. He looks up in terror as the Wilberforces loom —  UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo circles Mr Jones, furious.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You just left them there!

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: They were weak —

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Expendable, you mean!

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (roars)

dialogues.speaker: I HAD NO CHOICE
dialogues.text: The fire dims to a flicker. MR JONES (CONT’D) They had Johan — Lenart alone was useless to me. If I’d risked myself to save them, who would've been left to find more twins?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You don’t need twins. I can make the fire — enough for both of us! Mr Jones looks up, his eyes piercing Theo.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Rachel believes in your twin-ness. It’s her belief that gives you power.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: But at the beach —

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: You were weak. Theo leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: No ... they were afraid of me!

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (roars) Only because she believes! Theo stares at him, trembling with a fury that masks his own fear.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: You're wrong. I'll prove it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 150 151 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a last look at Rachel, Theo pockets his stone and storms away into the darkness. Alarmed Rachel scrambles to her feet —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel runs down a long passage, the light of Mr Jones's flame far behind her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo? Come back! Her voice echoes, met with stony silence. She stops — as far into the gloom as she dares go. RACHEL (CONT’D) I know you’re afraid. But we can do this, I know we can. She stares into the darkness, straining to see, searching for him. She closes her eyes, searching now for his mind.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo, please ... Silence. At last, she opens her eyes, tears welling. RACHEL (CONT’D) (whispers) I need you. Rachel sighs, alone in the dark. She turns and trudges back up the tunnel towards the firelight. Nothing stirs in the darkness ... then a ripple of FIRE like gasoline igniting, courses out from the stone in Theo’s hand, revealing him right there, watching her go. Wordlessly, he turns and heads down the tunnel, determine and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky waits anxiously in his car. The passenger door opens, Clementine peers in.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I need your help. There’s no one else I can trust. She considers, eyebrows raised ... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 152 153 154 155 156 157 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 78.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Is this that end of the world thing? Cos I’ve got work in the morning ... She meets his gaze. It’s serious. She gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel steps back into the cave where she left Mr Jones. She pauses, watching him. Mr Jones looks like he’s at death’s door. His eyes are closed. His breath rattles in his chest. Rachel kneels beside him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr Jones ... He opens his eyes. RACHEL (CONT’D) He’s gone on ahead. We have to get to the boat. He leans heavily on her as they get to their feet.From deep in the tunnels, a distant BARK rings out. Rachel and Mr Jones look around, alarmed. RACHEL (CONT’D) They’ve found us. They head into the tunnels, Rachel supporting Mr Jones. EXT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 157 Ricky reverses the car quietly down the driveway. He rolls to a stop in front of the SEA LADY, which sits beside the garage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 157A
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 79.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ricky and Clementine, straining together, heave the boat to the back of the car and hook up the trailer. Inside, Ricky starts the car. He revs the engine, trying to pull away. He cringes at the loud whine of his little car ... and yet the boat doesn’t move! He looks, sheepishly, to Clementine. He revs again. The car seems horribly loud in the night as, slowly, the car and boat start to move. He heads up the drive, his car straining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car reaches the top of the driveway. Ricky looks back, checking the boat — Clementine yelps in fright! Uncle Cliff, fully dressed, stands in front of the car. Ricky slams on the brakes and slumps against the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Ricky winds the window down a couple of inches.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Would you believe night fishing?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Dad, I know this doesn’t look good. But this time I’m asking you just to —

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Dad, you’re just gonna have to trust me: if I say I’ve gotta do something important, it’s important. Ricky meets his father’s gaze, eyes blazing with assertiveness. And is taken aback by what he sees. Uncle Cliff trembles, eyes twitching. Slime glistens at his jowls.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 158A
dialogues.text: UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 80.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF
dialogues.text: Get ... out ... of ... the ... car. Ricky looks him up and down ... to see his father’s hand stretching and distorting into a tangle of fibrous tentacles. His face drops — As the creature swings its arm like a club — CRASHING through the passenger window. Fine tentacles whip around Ricky’s face, the seat, the ceiling of the car — Clementine screams, recoils in horror. Ricky slams down on the accelerator — The car pulls away, dragging the CLIFF/WILBERFORCE along. Ricky is pulled hard against the door by the tentacles. He shakes to get his head free. The tentacles wrap themselves around the steering wheel, the door — The creature hanging from the door shudders and convulses as it changes from Uncle Cliff into a Wilberforce Drone. INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/TAKAPUNA STREETS - NIGHT 158 The car and boat pull out onto the road. A car HONKS as it swerves around them.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Look out! Ricky floors it, hammering down the suburban street. The Wilberforce hearse roars after him. At the door the Drone BARKS grotesquely, its face savage, as it bounces around, dragging on the road. Ricky grasps the door handle and jerks the door open. The Drone flails, hitting the road in a tumble of tentacles — right in the path of the oncoming hearse! The hearse screeches to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 159 160 161 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 81. INT/EXT. RICKY’S CAR/TAKAPUNA STREETS - NIGHT 158B Ricky and Clementine look back to see the Drone, still part-man, part-Wilberforce, leap across the bonnet of the hearse and into the passenger window, as the hearse continues the chase, further back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car roars down the boat ramp. Ricky tries to reverse the trailer into the water, going the wrong way, correcting, at last getting it right. Ricky and Clementine scramble out. The ominous clatter of the approaching hearse ... lights on the horizon ... The SEA LADY slips free of the trailer. Ricky clambers aboard, pulling Clementine up after him — A sudden ROAR — Ricky and Clementine look up — The hearse speeds off the boat ramp and soars overhead, crashing into the water. Bubbles on the surface ... dark shapes surface near the hearse and begin to give chase. Ricky tries to start the boat as the Wilberforces approach. It coughs once — twice — and catches! The boat motors away from the boat ramp, leaving the Drones behind.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SEA LADY/OPEN SEA
dialogues.text: The boat accelerates away out into the dark sea. Clementine stares at him, wide eyed and gasping.

dialogues.speaker: CLEMENTINE
dialogues.text: Tell me that wasn’t really your Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo picks his way down a stone staircase, carved from ancient rock. His stone glows in his hand. The sea churns rocks below him. He scans the water.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Come on, Ricky ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 162 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As if in answer, the Sea Lady comes into view, rising and falling with the choppy sea. Theo grins as Ricky motors in as close as he can, Clementine guiding him. The waves threaten to dash the boat against the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: (yells above the noise) You're gonna have to — CRASH! A wave smashes against the rocks. The Sea Lady is driven perilously close... then pulled back again.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Jump! Theo times it — the boat rises on a swell — he jumps, landing awkwardly. Clementine catches him.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: They’re not coming.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Rachel can’t do it. I’m going on my own. Ricky looks back up the hill, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ricky, there isn’t much time! Reluctantly, Ricky revs the boat and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones and Rachel hurry down a long tunnel. They reach an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Which way? Mr Jones considers ...

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: This way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 163 164 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They start down the tunnel — a clatter of Wilberforce BARKS from ahead of them ... or perhaps behind. Rachel and Mr Jones pause, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE IN THE TUNNELS
dialogues.text: A Wilberforce Drone steps into the light, searching for the twins. In human form, starting to fray a little at the edges. Two more Drones emerge from the darkness behind it. The Drone sniffs — chooses a tunnel and starts down it — WHOMP! A burst of flame momentarily drives them back, coming from — Mr Jones, hiding in wait with Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Back this way. They hurry back into the dark as the Wilberforces recover and stalk up the tunnel behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sea Lady coasts into the rocky shore. Theo leaps out of the boat and onto the rocks. He stops for a moment, looks back at the older teens.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: We'll wait for you. Theo nods, too adrenalised to speak. He turns and runs up the beach to the tree-line. Ricky looks anxiously back towards the city. Across the water, a burst of fire glows on North Head. Ricky frowns ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roar of fire lights a stone staircase, carved from the rock. Mr Jones and Rachel hurry to the shore, tripping and stumbling, Rachel struggling to support Jones's weight. They reach the rocky water’s edge. Rachel searches frantically for Theo and Ricky. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 165 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 84.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They left us! They wheel around, their backs to the sea. DARK SHAPES seem to melt out of the cliff and fan out around Mr Jones and Rachel, advancing slowly. Jones pushes Rachel behind him clumsily as they back away. He raises shaking, gnarled fists.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you stop them?

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Not for long. The central Wilberforce steps forward. His skin glistens with slime, his crude features beginning to dissolve. The creature allows itself a cruel smile. Rachel looks around the rocks ... and grins.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: We don’t need long. Jones looks ... and then sweeps a wall of flame in front of them. The Wilberforces rear back, shrieking. From behind the rocks Ricky roars up beside them. The Wilberforces fight to see through the flames ... To see Clementine helping Mr Jones and Rachel onto the SEA LADY as it pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BOAT/NORTH HEAD SHORE
dialogues.text: Ricky slams down the throttle and the boat roars away. Rachel hugs him tight. Mr Jones steadies himself on the edge of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where’s Theo? Ricky points to the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Up there. All four look ahead to the looming island, their faces grim...  166 167 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo climbs, panting with effort. He stops, gets his bearings. The bush around him rustles and cracks. He ducks low, looking around. His stone throbs with a pulsing glow. The distant BARK of a Wilberforce ... then an answering BARK, from just metres away! Theo freezes — The dark shape of a Wilberforce looms in the moonlight. It SNIFFS deeply, picking up his scent.Theo cowers ... and is suddenly YANKED violently from the ground, sinewy tendrils whipping around his body from behind! Theo flails — his stone FALLS — its light dims! CRUNCH! Theo arrests his passage on the thin trunk of a bush with one hand. He scrambles for the stone with the other. The tentacle tightens around him ... From around him, more vicious BARKS sound. DARK SHAPES melt out of the darkness to surround him. Barely seen, the Wilberforces have abandoned human form. They writhe with predatory power. Theo winces in pain ... as he reaches for the stone ... reaches — The Wilberforces close in — Theo’s hand closes around the stone! Theo swings around and — BLAM — sends cords of fire lashing out into the dark. The tentacles around him whip away ... The creatures shriek and bark, tentacles flail. Theo scrambles to his feet. He shoots forth another jet, clearing a path ahead of him and clambers on up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones and Rachel climb out of the boat onto the beach, then turn back to Ricky and Clementine.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: We won’t go far. Rachel and Mr Jones turn to go — (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 167 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 86.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rach? She turns back.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You too. She smiles, watches as Ricky motors out from the shore. Distant BARKS — Rachel and Mr Jones turn to see a FIERY GLOW lighting the sky from further up the mountain. RACHEL (CONT’D) He's fighting them.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Even if he gets to the crater and throws his stone, nothing will happen. It’s all been for nothing. He turns his back on her, looking at the city glowing on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Y’know, maybe those other twins would’ve made it if you’d stayed. If you’d helped them instead of saving yourself. His back still to her, Jones closes his eyes, the memory painful. RACHEL (CONT’D) You can go find more twins if you want. But I don’t get a choice — I'll die before I turn my back on him. She spins and races for the trees. Her words hit Mr Jones hard. He looks surprised, then suddenly resolute:

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: (croaks) Wait. He finds his voice:

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 167 168 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 87.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Rachel looks back.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1l take you up there. Rachel’s eyes widen, realising the sacrifice he’s making

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: But you’ll ...

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) I‘1l take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world ripples and shudders as a flame licks in the air ... then explodes into the shape of two figures.Mr Jones and Rachel appear at the foot of the viewing platform. Mr Jones collapses, his body wracked with shudders.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mr Jones! She bends down to him. Mr Jones looks up, weak.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: He’s here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Theo? Mr Jones shakes his head. Rachel looks up — A dark shape looms in the moonlight: Mr Wilberforce. Mr Jones rises shakily to his feet between them. He lifts his hands. Tiny licks of fire spark at his finger tips. Wilberforce regards the old man with disdain. Mr Jones holds out Rachel’s stone. Fearful, she meets his gaze. He nods:

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: Take it. Wilberforce advances on them, black eyes burning with hatred. Rachel closes her fingers around the stone, breathing deeply. She flinches ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 168 169 170 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: grits her teeth, riding the pain. SMOKE begins to hiss from between her fingers ... a CRACKLING as her flesh begins to burn! Mr Jones's eyes blaze, watching as Rachel shudders, tears streaming down her face ... her hand glowing white-hot around the stone. Mr Jones clamps his own hands around hers, wrapping them in healing flame. MR JONES (CONT’D) Remember, your belief is your strength. Hold on, for Theo. He releases her hands. She trembles, her fist shaking around the burning stone.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Theo ... hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo shoots a burst of flame behind him, then scrambles up the track towards the summit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Jones turns to Mr Wilberforce and meets his gaze, determined ... then falters. He falls to one knee, fading fast. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: MR JONES
dialogues.text: If they have to die, let them die together. Wilberforce almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: I will make sure of it. He clamps his hand on Mr Jones's face. His hand sinks into Jones’s flesh as the old man buckles. Rachel screams as the two cosmic forces meet — Wilberforce seems to absorb Jones from the head down ... the old man seems to incinerate from the inside out. A fire burns brightly ... then dies, a wraith of ash falling to the ground ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 89.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wilberforce looks to Rachel. She gasps, backing away — her fist clenched at her chest. With a terrifyingly fast movement his arm lashes out — over the five metres between them — and grabs her throat with a tangle of tentacles. Rachel beats at the tendrils wrapping around her neck with her closed fist as Wilberforce lifts her from the ground by her throat. She gags, fighting for breath ... Theo crests a rise to see the crater in front of him. Mr Wilberforce stands at the far end of the platform. He holds Rachel by her neck — his arm melding horribly with her own flesh. She hangs limply — the awful decay spreading across her body. Theo gasps in horror. He runs to the platform, his stone balled inside his fist. Theo raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Put her down. Wilberforce looks up with contempt. Rachel’s eyes GLAZE OVER. The glow of FIRE flickers from Theo’s stone ... then DIES. Theo looks down at the stone, incredulous ... he shakes it ... nothing happens. Mr Wilberforce drops Rachel in a heap, his arm a mass of writhing tendrils. Her eyes are glazed open, her mouth hanging limp. The sight hits Theo like a sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Mr Wilberforce smiles cruelly at Theo. A huge EARTHQUAKE rocks the mountain. Theo is thrown to the ground. Wilberforce rides the tremor, unperturbed. CRACKS ripple across the crater edge — The viewing platform sags, the planks rippling like piano keys. Rachel’s limp body slides towards the edge. From the beneath the ground the MASSIVE ROAR of the gargantua sounds, like some titan echo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 90.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: From behind Theo comes a clatter of BARKS. He turns to see the Drones ringed behind him. They advance. Theo holds up the lifeless stone ineffectually as the Wilberforces close in on him.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No ... no...

dialogues.speaker: MR WILBERFORCE
dialogues.text: Its sister dies. How does it feel? And now, finally, Theo FEELS it all: the loss of his mother, the loss of his sister.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I’m ... alone. Her glazed eyes stare — no response.

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rachel. I need you ... Desperate now, he calls again, not out loud, but WITH HIS

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I need you. ECU on Rachel’s EYES, fixed on him. She blinks — A rush of WHISPERS — growing to a ROAR — And in a furious flurry of images — Their mother’s face / their father / feeding as babies / in a pen together / toys / teddy bears / books / a cat / a house / spoon feeding / drinking / laughing / crawling / walking / running outside / fishing / horses / swimming / school / friends / birthday cakes / Christmas trees / milking a cow / dinners / laughter / tears / lost teeth / ice creams / holidays / pocket money / beaches / hide and seek / eye to eye / the two connected through twin-ness — WHISPERS form, as if from out of the distance ...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Theo ... Rachel’s seemingly lifeless eyes are fixed upon him.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m here. I always have been. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RACHEL’S FINGERS uncurl, slowly, blistered flesh cracking, revealing her STONE. It glows, warmly now. Her fist closes around it. Mr Wilberforce looms over Theo. A fiery halo circles Theo’s hands ... spreads across his body. He looks up — the look of anguish from moments before has been replaced by one of power, stronger than ever before. Wilberforce stops — taken aback ... as behind him, FIRE glows — Rachel rises, wrapped in a halo of rolling FLAME! Her eyes blaze with power. Theo gets to his feet, his eyes burning with the same power. The Drones SQUEAL and shrink back. Mr Wilberforce’s skin blisters, sloughs away to reveal a writhing mess of worms that shrivel and twist. His mass contorts into tentacles, limbs and claws, fighting at the fierce heat. Rachel steps up to meet Theo. He holds out his hand. As she takes it, her fire rolls to engulf him. These two human torches turn and face the crater. AS ONE they reach back and THROW their stones — As the stones leave their hands, they seem to draw the fire out of the twins, arcing high across the crater, leaving a burning trail of light. The two points meet at the apex — A column of FIRE rockets DOWN into the crater. A wave of scorching heat ripples outwards. Mr Wilberforce falls to the ground, a mess of flesh and fibre, disintegrating. Behind them, the Drones HOWL as they are blown apart. CRACKS appear in the crater, belching flame — The ground shakes — From below, the gargantua ROARS in its death throes. From the point above the crater, six fingers of flame arc out — The twins duck as the fiery trails roar overhead, shooting out across the harbour —  171 172 173 173 174 175 176 177 178 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 92.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 171
dialogues.text: The lines of fire cut through the night sky towards each of the six volcanoes where the gargantua reside: Mount Wellington, Mount Mangare, Mount Victoria, One Tree Hill, Mount Eden and Lake Pupuke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat bobs, seemingly empty ... Ricky and Clementine 1 appear from below deck, eyes wide in terror and wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pillar of fire blasts into the lake in front of the Wilberforce house. A huge explosion of STEAM erupts. INT. AUNT & UNCLE’S HOUSE - NIGHT 176 Aunt Kay and Uncle Cliff are shaken from their bed as the night turns to fiery day around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky and Clementine are bathed in a scarlet glow. Across the harbour scarlet fire rises from the six volcanoes, turning the sky above downtown Auckland red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viewing platform shakes violently as Theo and Rachel stumble back towards the crater rim. They look to each other, breathless, stunned. They allow themselves to share a smile ... then:

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Mr Jones? Rachel shakes her head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 178 179 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 93.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The mountaintop rumbles again, from deep within. The ground shakes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So what do we ...

dialogues.speaker: THEO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (overlapping) -.. do we do now ...? A huge jet of steam, glowing red from below, explodes up in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: We run! They turn and run down the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricky cuts the engine and leaps into the ankle-deep water, Clementine follows. They run up the beach. Ricky looks up at the dark hill above, capped by its blood red glow.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta go up there! He takes Clementine by both arms, looks into her face as he collects himself: brave, responsible.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve gotta go up there. As she nods, Theo and Rachel burst out of the trees a little way behind them.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Ricky!

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: Hey — where are you going? Ricky gapes, flabbergasted. He and Clementine WHOOP, celebrating as the twins run to the boat and clamber in.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: So! That went off quite well. All of them, really. Yeah — nice work. I was on my way up there, eh ... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179 180 181 182 UNDER THE MOUNTAIN © 2008 Redhead Films 94,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The twins grin. Theo turns to Rachel. She smiles and hugs him tight. Whispers swirl around them.

dialogues.speaker: THEO
dialogues.text: I was wrong about Mr Jones. About everything. Rachel nods, smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Let’s go home. Beyond, Ricky fires up the boat’s engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sea Lady motors across the harbour toward Auckland. Beyond, six sunrises seem to glow across the city.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SEA LADY/OPEN SEA
dialogues.text: Rachel and Theo look at the spectacle as Ricky heads for home.

dialogues.speaker: RICKY
dialogues.text: Reckon I can get the boat back before Dad notices it’s gone? You guys are gonna help me, right? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the boat, Rangitoto burns with terrible fire at its peak, the SUN rising beyond. FADE OUT.
